medical_history.chief_complaint: Swallowing a tooth from prosthesis with new onset lower umbilical pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was in usual state of health until this morning when he swallowed his tooth and a supporting piece of metal while eating an apple. He felt minor scratching on the way down his esophagus, but the pain subsided quickly. Several hours later, he experienced 4 bouts of loose, watery bowel movements with blood on tissue. He developed severe, intermittent, stabbing hypogastric and umbilical pain not improved with repositioning or PO intake.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), depression with recent evaluation for suicidal ideation, chronic low back pain, recent evaluation for liver function test abnormalities.
medical_history.family_history: Grandfather with liver cancer, father had diabetes mellitus (DM), no history of alcoholism.
